page.title: 01Eccleshall Introduction
page.content: Once the home of the{Bishops of Lich- {field}and still linked with them by its magnificent church, Eccleshall today is a country town of busy shops and one-time coaching inns, its main street protected by a conservation order. The area's populace comprises old farming families, artisans and businessmen; increasingly a commuter base, the town retains a caring comm- unity, mindful of young and old. From Eccleshall's wooded hollow and the protective arm of the{River Sow, fields interspersed with hamlets cover the surrounding countryside through which run some quiet leisure drives. Jewel of the landscape is{Copmere,} a small ice-age lake loved by waterfowl and fishermen. Some land is farmed by Council tenants, some by individuals; a proportion still belongs to old est- ates with their mellow houses.{
